speaker: Lord
text: The son of Duncan

speaker: Lord
text: (From whom this tyrant holds the due of birth)

speaker: Lord
text: Lives in the English court and is received

speaker: Lord
text: Of the most pious Edward with such grace

speaker: Lord
text: That the malevolence of fortune nothing

speaker: Lord
text: Takes from his high respect. Thither Macduff

speaker: Lord
text: Is gone to pray the holy king upon his aid

speaker: Lord
text: To wake Northumberland and warlike Siward

speaker: Lord
text: That, by the help of these (with Him above

speaker: Lord
text: To ratify the work), we may again

speaker: Lord
text: Give to our tables meat, sleep to our nights,

speaker: Lord
text: Free from our feasts and banquets bloody knives,

speaker: Lord
text: Do faithful homage, and receive free honors,

speaker: Lord
text: All which we pine for now. And this report

speaker: Lord
text: Hath so exasperate the King that he

speaker: Lord
text: Prepares for some attempt of war.

speaker: Lord
text: He did, and with an absolute Sir, not I,

speaker: Lord
text: The cloudy messenger turns me his back

speaker: Lord
text: And hums, as who should say You’ll rue the time

speaker: Lord
text: That clogs me with this answer.

speaker: Lord
text: I’ll send my prayers with him.
